intro: Decaspora cunninghamii, commonly known as the slender rock-daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Decaspora cunninghamii is often found in coastal and inland areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
